DOC.HEAD: Police Santa Snares Alleged Drug Dealers
Eds: SUBS 4th graf, `He approached..', to restore dropped word `would.'
DOC.TEXT: Santa wore a red stocking cap and a police badge as he handed out free gifts to the needy, but residents of an alleged crack house invited him inside anyway. As a result, four of the house's residents were spending Christmas weekend in jail, police said. Officer Conrad De Castro had been assigned to get a description of the house so police could seek a warrant to search it for drugs. He approached the house on Saturday in uniform, wearing the stocking cap and carrying presents. The occupants asked for some of his gifts, and he told them he would return with others. He did, with a few empty boxes all wrapped up, and other officers waiting outside. As the alleged drug dealers unwrapped the boxes, police said De Castro noticed one gift under their Christmas tree: a plastic bag that appeared to contain crack cocaine. De Castro used his walkie-talkie to alert other officers, who helped make the arrests, police said.
